summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorneys discussing whether to file an amended declaration regarding the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement, specifically to clarify what constituted the final agreement and to address victim notification letters.

persons.name: Epstein's attorneys
persons.context: Mentioned as having contended that the Non-Prosecution Agreement only consisted of parts I and II during discussions after an August 14, 2008 status conference.

events.title: Status conference in Epstein case
events.description: A status conference was held, after which Epstein's attorneys contended the Non-Prosecution Agreement only consisted of parts I and II.

keyFacts: There was confusion or dispute over what constituted the final Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement, with Epstein's attorneys arguing it only included parts I and II.
U.S. Attorneys were considering filing an amended declaration to clarify the issue of the final agreement.
Steps had been taken to send out amended victim notification letters.
The email exchange occurred on November 17, 2008, referencing discussions that took place after an August 14, 2008 status conference.
